etymologies: early 19th century. From the name of William Phillips, English mineralogist and geologist + -ite

definitions: A mineral of the zeolite group which has the composition KCa(Si₅ Al₃)O₁₆.6H₂ O, belongs to the monoclinic crystal system, and occurs as colourless, reddish, or yellowish twinned crystals, often forming spherulites or crusts.
